scenario:
The Bus Duct Market is projected to grow from USD 12.91 billion in 2024 to USD 16.60 billion by 2029, at a CAGR of 5.2%. The market is driven by elevated electrification and infrastructure, especially in industries such as utilities and transportation, who are high in demand for efficient distribution systems. Renewed government policies that attempt to speed up a shift towards renewable power and an improved grid modernization form fuel for the growth happening in the market.

Key segments covered in the report include:

- Product type
- Deployment mode
- Architecture
- End user
- Geographic regions (North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Middle East & Africa, and South America)

The data center segment is expected to be the fastest-growing market for bus ducts during the forecast period, driven by the rapid global expansion of cloud computing, artificial intelligence, big data analytics, and the Internet of Things.

The copper segment will be the largest market by material in the Bus Duct Market during the forecast period, due to its superior electrical and thermal conductivity, making it the preferred material for power distribution applications.

Asia Pacific is expected to hold the biggest market share in bus ducts throughout the forecast period, driven by the speed at which emerging economies such as China, India, and Southeast Asia undergo industrialization and urbanization.

Top companies in the Bus Duct Market include ABB (Switzerland), Siemens (Germany), Schneider Electric (France), Eaton (Ireland), and Legrand (France), which have aggressively embraced various strategies to enhance their presence and respond to the increasing demand for efficient power distribution systems.

Recent developments in the market include:

- LS Cable & System (South Korea) announced plans to build a new bus duct factory in Querétaro, Mexico, to serve as an export base for the North American market.
- ABB (Switzerland) acquired SEAM Group (US), a US-based energized asset management and advisory services provider, to expand ABB's Electrification Service portfolio in the US market.
